translation: Now begins the description regarding the arrival of the demon Aghasura

gurmukhi: ਜਾਹਿ ਕਹਯੋ ਅਘ ਕੰਸਿ ਗਯੋ ਤਹ ਪੰਨਗ ਰੂਪ ਮਹਾ ਧਰ ਅਾਯੋ ॥ ਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਹਨਯੋ ਭਗਨੀ ਸੁਨਿ ਕੈ ਬਧਕੈ ਮਨ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ ਤਹਾਂ ਕਹੁ ਧਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Jaah(i) Kahyo Agh Kans(i) Gado Tah Pannag Roop Mahaa Dhar Aayo|| Bhraat Hanyo Bhagadisoun(i) Kai Badh-kai Man Kruddh Tahaan Kauh Dhaayo||
translation: As commanded by Kansa, Aghasura assumed the form of a dreadful snake and went (for his errand) and hearing about the killing of his brother bakasura and his sister Putna, he was also highly infuriated;

gurmukhi: ਬੈਠਿ ਰਹਯੋ ਤਿਨ ਕੈ ਮਗ ਮੈ ਹਰਿ ਕੇ ਬਧ ਕਾਜ ਮਹਾਂ ਮੁਖ ਬਾਯੋ ॥ ਦੇਖਤ ਤਾਹਿ ਸਭੈ ਬ੍ਰਿਜ ਬਾਲਕ ਖੇਲ ਕਹਾ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਲਖਿ ਪਾਯੋ ॥੧੭੦॥
transliteration: Baith(i) Rahyo Tin Kai Mag Mai Har(i) Ke Badh Kaj Mahaan Moukh Baayo|| Dekhat Taah(i) Sabhai Baalak Brij Khel Kahaa Man Mai Lakh(i) Paayo||170||
translation: He sat down in the way, opening widely his dreadful mouth, keeping in his mind, his errand of killing Krishna; seeing him, all the boys of Braja, considered it a play and none could know his real objective.170.
Speech of all the gopas amongst themselves:

gurmukhi: ਕੋੳੂ ਕਹੈ ਗਿਰ ਮੱਧਿ ਗੁਫਾ ੲਿਹ ਕੋੳੂ ੲਿਕੱਤ੍ਰ ਕਹੈ ਅੰਧਿਅਾਰੋ ॥ ਬਾਲਕ ਕੋੳੂ ਕਹੈ ੲਿਹ ਰਾਛਸ ਕੋੳੂ ਕਹੈ ਪੰਨਗ ਭਾਰੋ ॥
transliteration: Ko( i)  Kahai Gir Maddh(i) Gouphaa Eh Ko( i)  Ikattra Kahai Andhdaro|| Baalak Ko( i)  Kahai Eh Raachhas Ko( i)  Kahai Eh Raachhas Ko( i)  Kahai Pannag Bdaro||
translation: Someone said that it is a cave within the mountain; someone said that there was the abode of darkness; someone said that it was a demon and some said that it was a huge snake;

gurmukhi: ਜਾਹਿ ਕਹੈ ੲਿਕ ਨਾਹਿ ਕਹੈ ੲਿਕ ਬਿਓਤ ੲਿਹੀ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਤਿਨ ਧਾਰੋ ॥ ੲੇਕ ਕਹੈ ਚਲੋ ਭੳੁ ਨ ਕਛੂ ਸੁ ਬਚਾਵ ਕਰੈ ਘਨਿ ਸਯਾਮ ਹਮਾਰੋ ॥੧੭੧॥
transliteration: Jaah(i) Kahai Ik Naah(i) Kahai Ik Biot Ihiman Mai Tin Ddaro|| Ek Kahai Chalo Bhau Na Kachhodh Su Bachaav Darai Ghan(i) Syaam Hadaro||171||
translation: Some of them expressed a desire to go into it and some of them refused to go and in this way, the discussion continued; then one of them said, “Go into it fearlessly, Krishna will protect us.”171.

gurmukhi: ਹੇਰ ਹਰੈ ਤਿਹ ਮੱਧਿ ਧਸੇ ਮੁਖ ਨਾੳੁ ਨਰਾਛਸ ਮੀਚ ਲਯੋ ਹੈ ॥ ਸਯਾਮ ਜੂ ਅਾਵੈ ਜਬੈ ਮਮ ਮੀਟ ਹੋ ਬਿਓਤ ੲਿਹੀ ਮਨ ਮੱਧਿ ਕਯੋ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Her Darai Tih Maddh(i) Dhase Moukh Naao Naraachhas Meech Layo Hai|| Syaam Joo Aaai Jabai Mam Meet Ho Biot Ehiman Maddh(i) Kayo Hai||
translation: They called Krishna and all of them entered in it and that demon closed his mouth; he had already thought about it that as Krishna would enter, he would close his mouth;

gurmukhi: ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਗੲੇ ਤਬ ਮੀਟ ਲਯੋ ਮੁਖ ਦੇਵਨ ਤੋ ਹਹਕਾਰ ਭਯੋ ਹੈ ॥ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੂਰ ਹੁਤੀ ਹਮਰੀ ਅਬ ਸੋੳੂ ਅਘਾਸੁਰ ਚਾਬ ਗਯੋ ਹੈ ॥੧੭੨॥
transliteration: Kaahn Gad Tab Meet Layo Moukh Devan To Hah-kaar Bhayo Hai|| Jeevan Moond Hootihamriab Sooo Aghaasur Chaab Gado Hai||172||
translation: When Krishna went in, he closed his mouth and there was great lamentation amongst the gods; all of them began to say that he was the only support o their life and he was also chewed by Aghasura.172.

gurmukhi: ਦੋਹਿ ਬਢਾੲਿ ਬਡੋ ਹਰਿ ਜੀ ਮੁਖ ਰੋਕ ਲਯੋ ੳੁਹ ਰਾਛਸ ਹੀ ਕੋ ॥ ਰੋਕ ਲੲੇ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਕਰਿ ਕੈ ਬਲ ਸਾਸਿ ਬਢਯੋ ਤਬ ਹੀ ੳੁਹ ਜੀ ਕੋ ॥
transliteration: Deh(i) Badhaae Bado Har(i) Jimoukh Rok Layo Uh Raachhas Hiko|| Rok Lae Sabh Hikar(i) Kai Bal Saas(i) Badhyo Tab Hiuh Jiko||
translation: Krishna prevented the full closure of the mouth of the demon by extending his body; Krishna obstructed the whole way with his force and hands and thus the breath of Aghasura began to be puffed up;

gurmukhi: ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਬਿਦਾਰ ਦਯੋ ਤਿਹਕੋ ਸਿਰ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਭਯੋ ਬਿਨ ਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਬਕੀ ਕੋ ॥ ਗੂਦ ਪਰਯੋ ਤਿਹਕੋ ੲਿਮ ਜਿੳੁ ਸਵਦਾਗਰ ਕੋ ਟੁਟ ਗਯੋ ਮਟ ਘੀ ਕੋ ॥੧੭੩॥
transliteration: Kaahn Bidaar Dayo Tihko Sir Praan Bhayo Bin Bhraat Bakiko|| Good Daryo Tihko Im Jio Savdaagad Ko Tout Gyo Mat Ghiko||173||
translation: Krishna tore away his head and this brother of Bakasura breathed his last; the marrow of his head came out like the breaking of the pitcher of ghee of some trader.173.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਹ ਭਯੋ ਤਬਹੀ ਨਿਕਸੇ ਹਰਿ ਗ੍ਹਾਰ ਸਭੇ ਨਿਕਸੇ ਤਿਹ ਨਾਰੇ ॥ ਦੇਵ ਤਬੈ ਹਰਖੇ ਮਨ ਮੇ ਪਿਖ ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਬਚਯੋ ਹਰਿ ਪੰਨਗ ਭਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Raah Bhayo Tab-hinikse Har(i) Gvaar Sabhe Nikse Tih Ndare|| Dev Tabai Harkhe Man Me Pikh Kaahn Badhyo Har(i) Pannag Bhdare||
translation: In this way, when the passage was created, Krishna came out alongwith his gopa friends from the head of the demon; all the gods were overjoyed to see Krishna surviving from the attack of the huge serpent;
